entry.title: Take Back the Web with GraphQL
entry.summary:
Description

GraphQL is an exciting technology that can help simplify web logic. Most of the attention has been focused on client-side improvements. This talk will show how GraphQL can structure your backend logic to reduce the client-side dependencies or remove them entirely!

entry.title: Take Back the Web with GraphQL
entry.summary:
Description

GraphQL is an exciting technology that can help simplify web logic. Most of the attention has been focused on client-side improvements, such as reducing payload sizes and reducing total number of requests. This talk will show how GraphQL can structure your backend logic to reduce the client-side dependencies or remove them entirely!

entry.title: Lightning Talks - Friday evening
entry.summary:
Summary

Lightning talks from Friday evening.

Description

  • 00:00 - Intro to Lightning Talks - MC Larry Hasting
  • 01:56 - Instrumental - Matthew J Desmarais
  • 07:14 - Statvent - Christian Wyglendowski
  • 12:04 - Switchboard - Kyle Adams
  • 16:14 - hy: a lisp variant - Paul Tag
  • 20:40 - 5 packages you need to know - Łukasz Langa
  • 26:24 - The future of Linux containers - Solomon Hykes
  • 32:08 - SciPy 2013 - Andy Terrel, Anthony Scopatz
  • 35:39 - BirdFish - Preston Holmes
  • 41:20 - Julython - Robert Myers
  • 44:20 - CLDR: Common locale data repository - Martin von Löwis
  • 48:49 - Spine demo and Python port of runtime - Terry Simons
